course_title: The Economics of Sustainable Development: Communities, Markets and Technology - COMM, MRKTS, TEC

sections.comments: This is a 3 credit course focusing on issues related to sustainable economic development. All eligible students may register. Additional seats are available for students participating in the International or Regional Service Learning program and the three credit summer session course, Economics 364B for which this course is a pre-requisite. Students wishing to participate in that program must apply through the Faculty of Arts Office of Regional and International Community Engagement. For more information please visit https://orice.ubc.ca/econ-364b-the-economics-of-sustainable-development-international/

description: Applied research and seminars on topics of concern to economists and communities located both locally and internationally. Environmental sustainability, sustainable livelihoods, development effectiveness, institutions, agency, ethics, and well-being. Theoretical approaches, case studies, and community-based learning.
